title: Outhue
author: Outhue
content: Happy Birthday¬† KING üëë BTCMay all the inhabitants in every corners on mother earth have your love in mind and adopts yours precious Satoshis, more adoptions in coming years and more centralized wars to be defeated, Long Life and Prosperity KING. Bitcointalk friends and famz,¬† what are your best bitcoin wishes in the coming years? Do you think that with the lower inflation rate and upcoming halving Bitcoin can finally be put side by side with Gold? Are there any possible ways that Bitcoin can be regulated without Nakamoto? I think only centralized exchanges will remain regulated and projects like Bitcoin can't be touched. What do you think?Will banks and BTC forever remain enemies or something new will come up? I asked this because a BTC group bought an old bank üè¶ and I don't see any reason why.

comments.author: pooya87
comments.body: Quote from: Outhue on January 04, 2023, 06:34:14 AMwhat are your best bitcoin wishes in the coming years? I wish we see less speculators adopt bitcoin who want to make a quick (fiat) profit and get out. I wish to instead see more people adopt bitcoin who want financial sovereignty. QuoteDo you think that with the lower inflation rate and upcoming halving Bitcoin can finally be put side by side with Gold?If you mean bitcoin's "inflation rate", I don't think halving is going to change anything about bitcoin to put it side by side with gold. They don't fall into the same category regarding age, spendability, adoption scale or even supply cap (gold isn't as limited as bitcoin).If you mean the global inflation rate, your question makes more sense since inflation will always push people towards converting their fiat to something that is a better store of value. Both gold and bitcoin are good options for that.QuoteAre there any possible ways that Bitcoin can be regulated without Nakamoto? I think only centralized exchanges will remain regulated and projects like Bitcoin can't be touched. What do you think?With or without the inventor of Bitcoin, it can never be regulated because it goes against its principles of being decentralized. However, centralized services like exchanges will be built on top of bitcoin and will be regulated.QuoteWill banks and BTC forever remain enemies or something new will come up?I don't think their position is going to change until mass adoption (which we aren't even close to).

comments.body: For sure many of us would wish for this technology to be accepted by more countries as a mode of payment. But I'd also add that I wish to remove all of the misconceptions about bitcoin for more people to recognize its usage and to lessen the number of people being a victim of volatility in its price because they lack the knowledge. As more people are knowing this technology, there is also a growth with the articles and topics which could give awareness towards non-crypto users. And if this progressive development would continue, I believe that it would yield for a betterment of this technology in general.Quote from: Ojima-ojo on January 04, 2023, 11:35:22 AMQuote from: Broadanbig on January 04, 2023, 11:26:33 AMOn the occasion of bitcoin forth coming birthday celebration, here are my wishes for bitcoin;I believe bitcoin will gain more adoption as the year's roll by and for the fact that we already have two countries who have legally adopted bitcoin, it will become easier for those coming into bitcoin to at least build some knowledge because what we need in the Bitcoin ecosystem is true Bitcoin users who know the fundamentals of bitcoin as an alternative currency and also an asset. We don't want to see speculators who may want to take advantage of the volatility of Bitcoin to make few bull's and cashing out there by dumping the price. Sad reality but that's just how a market works; people would take advantage of the market price volatility. What we should be afraid of is impressions that this technology is a gateway to become rich in an instant.

comments.body: Of course, we all want to see the adoption process increase higher than in previous years, where more people will learn and use bitcoin in their daily lives.But unfortunately, our wishes are different from the wishes of the government because they may not see the potential of bitcoin for them either.We've seen how Bitcoin has worked so far without Satoshi Nakamoto but I suspect some of the people he's been working with are still watching Bitcoin and maybe Satoshi is still watching Bitcoin from afar.And there is a possibility that banks and BTC can work together because BTC users cash out their BTC into their bank accounts, so the bank needs to request further verification from them.And there are still many possibilities that could happen in the coming years.
